docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 29 -- Vice President Richard M. Nixon made a surprise visit to Montevideo University's Law School today and told many skeptical students why the United States had good relations with Latin-American dictators.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 29 -- Vice President Richard M. Nixon made a surprise visit to Montevideo University's Law School today and told many skeptical students why the United States had good relations with Latin-American dictators.
docs.abstract: Vice Pres Nixon explains to Uruguayan law students that pressure by domestic indus was responsible for tariffs that made it impossible for Uruguay to sell more than 1/2 of its exportable wool, '57, Montevideo U Law School

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, April 30 -- Vice President Richard M. Nixon declared here today that Argentina's return to democratic rule would signal the beginning of "a new era in the history of cooperation and friendship between Argentina and the United States."
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, April 30 -- Vice President Richard M. Nixon declared here today that Argentina's return to democratic rule would signal the beginning of "a new era in the history of cooperation and friendship between Argentina and the United States."

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 2 -- President Eisenhower today praised international golf as a means of easing world tensions. He made a suggestion to golf officials gathered here from thirty-five nations: Let a few duffers play in a world tournament. that the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 2 -- President Eisenhower today praised international golf as a means of easing world tensions. He made a suggestion to golf officials gathered here from thirty-five nations: Let a few duffers play in a world tournament. that the competition calls for a four-man team of experts to represent each country in seventy-two-hole play. Only the three low scorers on each team will be counted.
docs.abstract: Pres urges duffers be allowed to play in world amateur golf event, internatl golf officials conf; comments on game; US Golf Assn to establish cup in his hon; Pres gets silver seal from officials to commem conf; illus

docs.snippet: New York City this week will be the focal point of export sales drives coming from much of the world. These will be concentrated in the 1958 United States World Trade Fair, opening at the New York Coliseum on Wednesday. The fair, in which some sixty...
docs.lead_paragraph: New York City this week will be the focal point of export sales drives coming from much of the world. These will be concentrated in the 1958 United States World Trade Fair, opening at the New York Coliseum on Wednesday. The fair, in which some sixty nations will be represented, will run until Saturday, May 17. Exhibits filling all four floors will offer thousands of products seeking a share of the vast American market.

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, May 4 -- An 18-year-old, student was arrested by Paraguayan secret policemen here this afternoon for shouting "Long live freedom and democracy!" while an enthusiastic crowd cheered Vice President Richard M. Nixon.
docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Paraguay, May 4 -- An 18-year-old, student was arrested by Paraguayan secret policemen here this afternoon for shouting "Long live freedom and democracy!" while an enthusiastic crowd cheered Vice President Richard M. Nixon.
docs.abstract: US Vice Pres Nixon in Asuncion; confs with Stroessner; surrounded by emotional crowds after he places wreath on Heroes Pantheon; police seize 1 youth for shouting 'Long live freedom and democracy'; many with anti-Stroessner petitions kept from reaching Nixon

headline.main: NIXON VISIT STIRS PARAGUAY YOUTHS; Student Shouting 'Freedom' Is Seized -- Throng Erupts in Emotional Greeting
